content: z16 AGZ Compression/Decompression accelerator is implemented in the Nest Accelerator Unit (NXU) on each processor chip of the IBM Telum microprocessor. IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ On-Chip Compression delivers industry-leading throughput and replaces the zEDC Express PCIe adapter available on the IBM z14. One Nest Accelerator Unit (NXU) is used per processor chip, which is shared by all cores on the chip and features the following benefits:  Brand new concept of sharing and operating an accelerator function in the nest  Supports DEFLATE compliant compression/decompression and GZIP CRC/ZLIB Adler  Low latency  High bandwidth  Problem state execution  Hardware/Firmware interlocks to ensure system responsiveness  Designed instruction  Run in millicode The On-Chip Compression Accelerator removes this virtualization constraint because it is shared by all PUs on the processors chip; therefore, it is available to all LPARs and guests.
